page.title: 17OUTSIDE ASKAM AND IRELETH
page.content: There is much to interest the student of natural history in the entire block such as: outcrops of various rock series which include the very fossiliferous lower carboniforous limestones and red sandstones, not to mention the igneous rocks of the Lake District Dome. These are of great interest to the geologist and palaeontologist. In the fields of flora and fauna the usual plant and animal life which favours this terrain are there in abundance, ranging from simple algae to super evolved creatures like the peregrin falcon. For the archaeologist not only are there prehistoric remains but much to interest the student of written history including much for the industrial archaeologist particularly ancient farm tools and equipment.
